explains: adj. 现代的；当今的；现在的；现时的

sentences.en: For a few years its luminosity flared up to about 10,000 times the present-day luminosity of the Sun.
sentences.cn: 有几年它的亮度一度达到了现在的太阳亮度的一万倍左右。

sentences.en: It was little by little that the watch reached its present-day perfection.
sentences.cn: 表渐渐地达到了现在这样完美的程度。

sentences.en: Research shows that present-day women think differently and behave differently from men.
sentences.cn: 研究表明，现代女性的思维方式和行为方式都与男性不同。
